column2: As hunt for Allergan drags on
column3: some Valeant owners have doubts NEW YORK/BOSTON A few months ago
column4: an innovative partnership between Valeant Pharmaceuticals  and billionaire investor William Ackman to buy Botox maker Allergan Inc  looked like a blueprint for success. Now some Valeant shareholders who backed the deal at its start are questioning whether it will become reality.

column2: BofA in $16.5 bln deal with U.S. over mortgage bonds -source WASHINGTON
column3: Aug 20 Bank of America Corp  is expected to pay more than $16.5 billion to end investigations into mortgage securities that the bank and its units sold in the run-up to the financial crisis
column4: in a deal that could be announced as early as Thursday
column5: a person  familiar with the matter said.

column2: U.S. Ex-Im Bank backers pin hopes on temporary reauthorization WASHINGTON
column3: Aug 20 Business backers of the U.S. Export-Import Bank said on Wednesday they hope the institution's charter will be extended temporarily while Congress hashes out a longer-term reauthorization of the bank
column4: which some lawmakers are bent on closing.
